newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel derives no help from crude.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel derives no help from crude.

text.p: Low sulphur straight run fuel took little support from rallying crude with a 45,000 tonne cargo sold at $126.50 fob NWE, close to yesterday's levels.
Two cargoes were sold on Tuesday at $125 and $125.75 fob NWE. The recent deals have thinned out the market and sellers were hopeful of sustaining prices.

High sulphur straight run was priced around formula +$3 amid supplies reduced by two deals done on Tuesday at formula +$3.25 and $2.75 cif NWE. But, dealers said avails were still good. Several M-100 cargoes were expected to go into the barge market.
